Helix Tutorial

Learn the fundamentals of Helix Editor. Helix is aselection-based modal editor inspired by Kakoune. Unlike Vim where you act then select, in Helix youselect then act.

Key Concept: Selection-First

In Helix, you always select text before performing an action. This is the opposite of Vim. For example, to delete a word:wd(select word, then delete), notdw.

Command Reference

Movement

Navigate efficiently through your code

h, j, k, lMove left, down, up, right
w, b, eNext word, previous word, word end
W, B, EWORD navigation (space-separated)
f, tFind/till character
gg, GGo to first/last line
0, $Go to line start/end

Selection

Select text efficiently - Helix is selection-based

xSelect current line, extend to next
XExtend selection to line bounds
vEnter select (visual) mode
VEnter line-wise select mode
;Collapse selection to cursor
%Select entire file

Changes

Edit text with minimal keystrokes

i, aInsert before/after selection
I, AInsert at line start/end
o, OOpen new line below/above
dDelete selection
cChange selection (delete + insert)
y, p, PYank, paste after/before
rReplace character
~Switch case
>, <Indent, unindent
JJoin lines

Surround

Work with brackets, quotes, and delimiters

mEnter match mode
mi(Match inside parentheses
ma(Match around parentheses
mi[, ma[Match inside/around brackets
mi{, ma{Match inside/around braces
ms"Add surround (after selecting)
mr("Replace surround
md"Delete surround

Multi-cursor

Edit multiple locations simultaneously

CCopy selection to next line (add cursor)
sSplit selection by regex
,Keep primary selection
Alt-,Remove primary selection

Pro Tips

Always know your mode

Watch the mode indicator in the status bar. Press Escape to return to normal mode if unsure.

Think in selections

Before pressing any command key, ask yourself: what should I select first?

Use counts

Prefix commands with numbers: 3w jumps 3 words, 5x selects 5 lines.

Multiple cursors are powerful

Use C to create multiple cursors, then edit them all at once.

Ready to practice?

Put your knowledge to the test with interactive challenges.
